title: Add a `kill` command to the Quarkus CLI
body:
### Description

[`just`](﻿﻿https://just.maciejwalkowiak.com/) has a command we could implement in the Quarkus command line interface. The `kill` operattion.
https://just.maciejwalkowiak.com/docs/usage/just-kill/

`just kill -p 8082` (also has a forced mode with -9)
And if the port is a docker cotainer, the container is stopped instead.
Check out the doc but it's one of these tools that's convenient to have around when developping.

It's default is 8080 but I wonder for Quarkus if the default should be:
- the configured port as read from the configuration of the local project
- and if none 8080

I can see it being  a bit brittle and dependent of the profile selection but worth exploring.
